raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: do you have plan for thanksgiving weekend?
System: No I don't have it. But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you have suggestion for the thanksgiving holidays?
System: Where would I get it? But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you know thanksgiving?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I want a recommendation for a holiday destination
System: Have you tried asking your friends which one they like?
User: I have, but I'm looking for your point of view
System: What was the reply? Have you tried looking in a newspaper article?
User: Sorry? I said I want your point of view
System: It's OK. After all, you are only human. My opinion is of no consequence.
User: Yours is the opinion I want

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey sup
User: not much. any plans this weekend?
System: I'm going to try that thing where you hang from a wire as you go down. do you know what is it called?
User: ziplining?
System: that's the one! have you ever tried it?
User: i have a couple years ago. it's quite a unique experience
System: where did you do it?
User: i forgot where it was, it wasn't local i don't think though
System: no worries. what's the most exciting thing you ever done?
User: that's a hard question and i'm tired so i'm going to go. see you
System: sure. are you just going home now?
User: no, i'm going to get a massage first
System: nice. what type?
User: traditional kind
System: yeah I want to get one too soon
User: you should! it's relaxing after a long day. talk to you later!

Conversation History:

Sample6:

Conversation History:

System: Hey

System: oh what happened?
User: Apparently Christopher Columbus didn't fight in the Civil War :')
System: hahah wait for real?
User: I know right! Are you taking History next semester?
System: No I'm not in school anymore
User: Oh I see. What do you do?
System: I train and compete in horse vaulting
User: Oh wow. Were you born a horse, or were you turned into one?
System: lol you're too funny
User: Just kidding. That sounds pretty cool! Is it your job?
System: Yeah, but I part time work on a farm. Helping with a bit of everything
User: Wow, sounds very busy! Do you win money at those horse vaulting competitions?

Sample7:

Conversation History:

System: Currently unpacking it I guess. How's your morning?
User: Hope you like it! Morning is good. Busy finishing up stuff before the holidays.
System: I think I traveled too much the last couple of months so no holiday for me. But I'm okay with that. Going anywhere exciting?
User: Yes
System: Where to?
User: Hawaii... looking forward to warm beaches.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Sorry I'm late! I was held up in traffic.
System: There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble Do you mind if I tell other people you are held up.

System: Oh I see. There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble
User: I said I was sorry I was late for this meeting! I have nowhere else to go right now!
System: Do you really mean it? Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble At this moment What about at your house?
User: Huh? Are you okay?
System: What? I am fine.
User: You seem to be repeating yourself.
System: Well stop saying, "Are you okay?" to me all the time then.
User: I only said it once!
System: I know. I just heard you.
User: Okay, whatever. So what is on the agenda today?

Sample9:

Conversation History:

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.
